column4: how can i modify my xorg config file?  displayconfig-gtk doesnt seem to work for me
Do what now?
You want to edit or reconfigure xorg.conf ?
I want to reconfigure it.  Its not letting me use intel experimental drivers or set my monitor
so?
I have no idea what you did for your experamental drivers
..and I'm going to bed
Catch me when I'm not a few drinks in and have to wake up early for a meeting..
sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-xorg though, maybe...
Again, I dunno if you're using restricted drivers, or something you got somewhere
its prolly using the generic driver.. Did you install ubuntu-restricted-extras or uh.. erm.. wtf is the restricted driver dialog thingy
jockey-gt
jockey-gtk ...
thanks
You /could/ edit /etc/X11/xorg.conf and specify the drivers by hand..
thats assuming they're installed all nicey nice
under section "Device", specify Driver
do i put the driver file or the name of the driver?
the name of the driver
You gotta know what the name of it is.. like Driver "nvidia" or Driver "ati" or Driver "fglrx"
Use the restricted drivers thingy like I mentioned
it /sometimes/ works
all the drivers on that page are working
